issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Fixed two bugs in Counters because of which web app displays zero counter values for framework counters.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Looking at the job counters page on the history server for a finished job, it shows 3 columns for each counter - map, reduce, total. The total appears correct, but map and reduce columns are always zero.  If you click on a particular column it does show you the map/reduce task and the value of each one.

Going to attach screenshots shortly.
fields.summary: history server web ui - job counter values for map/reduce not shown properly

comments.body: Attaching patch. Please review.
Tested patch with wordcount example. Attaching screen shot which displays map/reduce counter values properly.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12512925/jobcounter3.png
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1744//console

This message is automatically generated.
Seems Jenkins has not picked up patch, picked up snapshot attached.
Reattaching the patch from Bhallamudi.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12513072/MAPREDUCE-3686.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 6 warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1760//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1760//console

This message is automatically generated.

@Bhallamudi,
 Shouldnt you be using factory.newFrameworkGroup(int id), when the group is a framework group?
Thanks Mahadev for reviewing the patch. Incorporating above comment. Please review.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12513954/MAPREDUCE-3686-1.path
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1830//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1830//console

This message is automatically generated.

Nice catch Kamesh! Both the bugs.

Patch looks good too. Tested and verified. +1. Pushing this in.
Just committed this to trunk, branch-0.23 and branch-0.23.1. Thanks Kamesh!
